website_summaries.verdict: One of the best budget floor gaming chairs available on the market.
pros: Resists staining and messes due to the rugged leather fabric
cons: Chair can slide around on carpet

customer_reviews.title: Bang For Buck/Holds Weight
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, better than I expected, pretty sturdy material. Every other review question who could use it based on size and weight. Im a 5'6" 225lb adult male, and I can confirm that it was perfectly comfortable for me, and held my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: so far so good!
customer_reviews.text: My son has been complaining that he needs a gaming chair since the sofa was too far from the TV yet the floor was too uncomfortable. I bought him this and so far he LOVES it. He is 12 yrs. old, 80 lbs. and so far has spent 5+ hr stretches on this playing on his ps4. He says it is super comfy. mom for the win!
customer_reviews.author: MomWithAnAmazonProblem

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure why there are some bad reviews on this
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why there are some bad reviews on this. It's just a straight up video game chair and what you see is what you get. Also I really don't know how people instantly fell backwards in this because I literally have to push myself back to fall back (which is sometimes fun). I bought two for my husband for his birthday and he said they're just like the ones he had when he was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my teens room
customer_reviews.text: Right price. Perfect for my teens room. He loved them
customer_reviews.author: Jommystew

customer_reviews.title: The chair is really pretty uncomfortable- there's wood planks that line the seat and ...
customer_reviews.text: I mean, you get what you pay for. The chair is really pretty uncomfortable- there's wood planks that line the seat and dig into your behind because the cushion is thin. The worst part was it smelled SUPER bad (like a really strong chemical fume that didn't go away for weeks). But it was cheap and if I sit on a pillow with it, it's not terrible. I would recommend spending more for better quality, but it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jacks

customer_reviews.title: Better then sitting on the floor.
customer_reviews.text: It's not the most comfortable chair around but it is 10 times more comfortable then the floor. For thirty bucks it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: OK for basics
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable chair I have sit in, but then I bought it for grandson for his "man cave". Edges are not padded, so if you are oversized at all, you may be sitting on the frame with only fabric between you and it. Other than that, it does the job that he wanted for it. For the price paid, it's fine, but if you want something to last and stay around for a long time, may want to get a more padded seat.
customer_reviews.author: GLM in VA

customer_reviews.title: What I Expected for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great for relaxing and playing some video games... Cheap and well constructed. What more could one ask for? You get what you pay for, so while this may not be the most feature packed/heavily padded chairs out there, it is one of the cheapest.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that sat low, and didn't take up much room. This chair seemed like the best solution, and I'm mostly happy with it. I'm 5'6" and 155lb, and the chair fits ok. I've played long gaming session without back pain, but my hinder will start hurting due to the lack of padding in the chair. I had to put a small coffee table behind the chair, so I could prop it up. The chair's equilibrium made it too low for the viewing angle (which killed my neck). Overall I wouldn't purchase it again I would try to find something a little better made.
customer_reviews.author: Tom.B

customer_reviews.title: Made gaming experience more than wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I have gotten it, it was a nice seating and made my gaming experience more than wonderful! Some reviews say it's easy to push back in resulting falling back, it really depends where you place your feet. If you want to sit up, have your legs flat in front where your body is shaped as an L. If you want to lay back, have your legs criss cross apple sauce or in the shape of a upside down "V". I fully enjoy this seat as it's very comfortable or easy support. If you would like better seating as in sitting up straight, just place a bedroom pillow behind your back. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Zachery Crossman

customer_reviews.title: Far from great
customer_reviews.text: Not for anyone over 50lbs. Very cheaply built. You can feel each of the Wood supports through the thin stuffing. Would not recommend to friends or family. Don’t bother with this brand if you’re looking for a quality gaming chair.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: I have had a gamer chair before and it was so comfortable but this was torture
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited for and didn't pay attention to the reviews. I have had a gamer chair before and it was so comfortable but this was torture. The bottom of the chair where you sit has no cushioning at all and wears out instantly. Within the first week no one that came over wanted to use the chair because it formed a dip in the middle. BEWARE this is complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie Valmaggi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small sized person.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only 85 pounds, it is great for me to do anything on this chair. I actually do not use it to play video games, but it's perfect for gift wrapping, browsing on my computers, and chatting with friends. It's super light weight. My fiance is 170 pounds, he avoids the chair because it tends to flip backward on him, which I don't mind, the chair is all mine!
customer_reviews.author: Mellazine

customer_reviews.title: Tween sized chair
customer_reviews.text: Well, they mailed us the pink one when we ordered the black one. So it had to be returned. Worth noting, it's pretty small looking for an adult. We didn't sit on it or even remove it from the box since it was pink, but it was pretty much tween size in our opinion. I don't mean that as a negative, I just wanted to mention it for anyone wondering how the product dimensions translate into real life. I'm 6 feet tall and I wouldn't want to sit on something this narrow or small. The seller kindly refunded me once the chair was returned.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: Very fast shippping! My son likes them for gaming chairs. They are lightweight but sturdy. I would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: aimee toner

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: The chair seems to be free of defects, the stitching is well done, and the fabric seems like it should hold up to regular use. I was very happy at how quickly it arrived, despite the shipping challenges due to the current state of affairs. Considering buying a second one for myself, as it is actually very comfortable (wasn't expecting that with being post-op from spinal surgery). I also like the fact that it's fairly lightweight and easy for my younger kids to move from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: We use these every day
customer_reviews.text: For 3 months during this pandemic we have been home a lot and so for reading, sitting and talking, or gaming .. these chairs are great. My 8 yr old and husband (200 pounds) can both sit comfortably in them.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Lorree

customer_reviews.title: Literally coming apart at the seams
customer_reviews.text: My son weighs 60 pounds; hardly a beast. After just 4.5 months, the fabric has ripped in 3 places (on seams, one rip is 6 in.) and the seat feels like your butt is sitting on an open box (where did the padding go??). I know this was not an expensive item, but still...
customer_reviews.author: T. Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable gaming chair
customer_reviews.text: Awsome gaming chair . Comes in a few colors I believe . The chair is great for ages 5 and up " DEPENDING " on your body build and height . I'm a 29 year old male , 5 ' 10 , slim body build and I fit just snug in it . Fixes sore backs / tail bones because of hours of gaming . This is a perfect gift for a grandson/son who plays video games .
customer_reviews.author: Georgie boy

customer_reviews.title: We love it ! Perfect sit, good cushion, and fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Best product I bought when there were offers online! This seating gaming chair is the best I've ever had. I love how I can place it on the floor and just sit on it and it's super comfortable, it also helps with posture, well at least for me I like that it has the back part so you're not slouching or anything like that. I normally don't sit straight so this is good for my back. My husband loves it as well and he kind of has stolen it from me now, he's playing videogames in our living room again instead of his room XD
customer_reviews.author: Cecy ZO

customer_reviews.title: Zero complaints from the kids
customer_reviews.text: If your kids don’t pick at the material then it will last a good while... I bought 2 for my kids one lasted about 6 months before the seat part of it fell apart and the other is still going strong ...both my kids loved them and had zero complaint about comfort...my kids are 9 and 10 both are average in size and weight
customer_reviews.author: WhitneyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: My 12 year old is very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old and he loves it! I should have bought one for my 8 and 3 year old because they are constantly trying to take it and sit in it to! It serves it's purpose. He just got it for Christmas so we shall see how long it lasts as far as wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: John & Kati

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very uncomfortable. The cushioning is thin. It feels like you're sitting on a wooden pew plus when leaning back it feels like something hard is resting against your head.
customer_reviews.author: JK Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: These Do The Job
customer_reviews.text: For gaming chairs at a bargain price, you can’t go wrong here. The covering is high quality and these can take a lot of abuse. I particularly like the mesh around the edges. It really adds to the durability of the faux leather. Otherwise, the covers would rip along the edges. Nice design that sets this chair apart from others I have seen. Would definitely buy again but won’t have to because these will stand the test of time!
customer_reviews.author: Jlab74

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for but still not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to complain with such a great price. It a good looking chair and at first sight it looks like a quality product. However it feels like you are sitting on pieces of wood wrapped in thin leather like material, which is exactly what it is. There is just NO padding. I still use it but I will buy a more expensive one next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: This are nice little chairs that help my grandchildren have better posture when playing games on Nintendo or watching tv. My 8 and 6-year-old grandsons love them.. Guess what? This old Nana likes them too. I have sat in them to play along with the kids and felt quite comfortable. I am a healthy 160 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Overall It's OK, not great. Small, unbalanced - easitly tips over when not being used
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad for the price, but not that great either. It is pretty small, more for children and small teens. It is not balanced well, as it easily tips over when nobody is sitting in it. It does look good, and I'm glad it has cloth material on the sides, but would prefer one that is all cloth with no vinyl. I worry about the durability of the vinyl. I wish I could find a media or "banana chair" like we used to call them like they used to make. Solid, covered with high quality furniture fabric, no frills.
customer_reviews.author: TechDealShopper

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for with this product...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for with this product. The presentation of the product is accurate with the official and user images. But as a 5'10" 160lb guy I find the chair pretty uncomfortable if don't sit in a very specific location. The unfortunate thing about that seating position is that it has zero neck support and can become very obnoxious after a while. I intend on keeping the product, but I probably would recommend spending a bit more money to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Vehshya

customer_reviews.title: Great chair. My husband doesn’t allow the dogs on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great chair. My husband doesn’t allow the dogs on the furniture (can you believe that lol) so this is a compromise. The dogs and I can sit in this chair for as long as I want without being uncomfortable. I know it’s a gaming chair but it works great for this purpose too.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Carvajal

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: For the money it's a good chair. It's nice easy to clean fabric. The only negative review I have is that I wish it was larger. If you have a tall child it's not going to last for a long time. My 8 year old is already almost to big for the chair, his head over over the top already. I was disappointed to see how small the char was in person as I thought it would be larger. For a younger child or a shorter child it would be good.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the kids: 1 and 6yro. They rock, roll, and climb all over it - yes they sit too. It is durable enough, and takes various spills well. My wife and I fit it, though for the under 15 crowd it is ideal. Great floor chair, great value. I'd say a near must for kids and TV/Gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Netgurney

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it but...
customer_reviews.text: The Easter Bunny brought these for my kids (9&10) to use whole they play video games. They love them but after a few uses the Staples holding the fabric to the frame on the back have cone off causing a few cuts on arms/legs as you walk by or snags on clothing. It's an easy fix but I shouldn't have to fix anything so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Morales

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: It is very lightweight and rather small in the adult size (I'm a small woman, I can't imagine anyone larger than me using it comfortably). My main complaint is with the smell of the vinyl. The chair has a very strong odor that I can only hope will diminish in time. Other than that it's comfortable enough. Addendum: After nearly a month the smell is still intolerable for me. It gives me a headache and makes my throat sore I don't know what is being off-gassed, but I've had enough. The chair is going to the SA. Hopefully someone less sensitive to the chemicals will give it a good home.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: X box viewing chair ~ it's what all ten year olds do....I guess.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 10 year old Grandson. Not such a fan of all of this x-box and gaming venues that occupy our grandchildren's time. But, rather than purchase something he would not like, I went with this. As far as I know, it is down in the gaming room and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Oma

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than imagined it would be and is just not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than imagined it would be and is just not comfortable for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Not for rough housing or overweight dads
customer_reviews.text: Waited a month to write this. The chair is a frame with pleather pillow case. When you sit on it you sit in a sling between 2 peices of plywood. There is no cushion to this chair. The mid back support has come loose inside... for my 40lbs kid it's all good. For my 200lbs ass it does the job. For the price it's all good. The one I had years ago was solid with padding
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap chair
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these for the living room. I'm 6'3" and 200lbs and as such a little concerned I wouldn't fit right, but it's actually pretty comfy. It could use more padding, but for what it costs it's fine. I have to push my butt forward a little or it has a tendency to roll over backwards. My 3yr old daughter now puts pillows behind it for me so I don't "bonk my noggin".
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not as I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not intended for adults. Child sized only. Not padded well, but fine for kids age 12 and under. I previously had taller and wider "banana chairs" (as my grandchildren call them) that after 30 years, are worn out. I will get them reupholstered for the older kids and adults.
customer_reviews.author: jonnialogy

customer_reviews.title: How you sit seems to determine if you tip backwards
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 10" 220lbs and I fit decent enough in this chair. I sit with my bottom towards the front edge and have no problems tipping backwards. My kids 5' 8" sit back more and they tip backwards. A little adjustment where you sit seems to determine if you tip or not. I put rubber stops on the back for my kids and they love them.
customer_reviews.author: Annette G

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good price and decent chairs but I can see why they were cheaper than others. One of the chairs had a screw beneath the leather protruding from the side. Luckily I saw it and my husband was able to knock it in without puncturing the leather, but the kids wanted to know why Santa’s elf’s would have been so careless....
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Keys

customer_reviews.title: They like them, and I don't have to worry about ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my pre-teens in lieu of beanbag chairs for basement TV watching. They like them, and I don't have to worry about the inevitable beanbag explosion. They're also light weight, so can be moved around the house when extra seating is needed (family movie time, football games, etc.). They work for us because we have a lot of space where they are mainly used, but may not be the best choice for people who have smaller spaces and storage is limited, if they aren't to be left out at all times.
customer_reviews.author: roxd

customer_reviews.title: Good chairs
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these they are great for the kids playing games o. The Xbox. They love them and the use them all the time. They love to rock all the way back onto their backs in them. So far standing up well to kids wear and tear. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: swjpilot

customer_reviews.title: Kids only!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9-year-old and it worked fine for him. However, it is not built to hold an adult's weight. My 20-year-old son (150 lbs) and I (170 lbs.) have used it too and the seat bottom is collapsing. I guess you get what you pay for because it is very inexpensive, but you really can only let kids use it or it will fall apart. That said, I would buy it again, but just keep the big people off it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than anticipated; won't rock back up from floor.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son who is a 12-year old of average height. He liked the look but he feels like it's too small, and if you rock the chair backward all the way, it doesn't rock back up like other video rocker chairs. Not particularly comfortable. We returned it and bought a "saucer chair" instead, which he liked much better.
customer_reviews.author: O41-112

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my son wanted and needed. I had bought one of those beanbag chairs for him but after about 3 weeks it was all out of shape, so when I seen this chair I ordered it immediately. Very happy with my purchased!! Its good for now til he wants the big gaming chair.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Gales

customer_reviews.title: looks cute, feels crummy
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing inaccurate in the product description or picture. At the same time, I didn't expect this chair to look or feel as cheap as it does. The wood is very "feelable" underneath the upholstery, and I will be surprised if this lasts a year. All in all, I'd say it would be better to spend a bit more to get a product that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this chair. He loves to rock and and this provides that for him and his sensory needs. Awesome buy at an awesome price.
customer_reviews.author: SteviTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very well used by a nine year old. It is comfortable to him and he loves the red and black colors. After months of use the seems have started separating, but my son is rough with it.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan H.

customer_reviews.title: Got for child
customer_reviews.text: I knew it would rock, but you have to have something to catch it. Easily flips. Like a couch or bed behind it. It works for us in 2 of 3 rooms cause he can sit in it. The big room no as nothing behind it where he likes to be.
customer_reviews.author: Sschnupp

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This chair is cute and absolutely what I wanted but it has no padding what so ever. I refuse to sit in it but my son uses it all the time. My advice is don’t buy this. Find something better
customer_reviews.author: TAM

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable at all!
customer_reviews.text: It feels like you are sitting on the corner edge a 1x4 board. I bought two of these and tried to make the most of them, but I just ended up taking them to Goodwill. DO NOT BUY! For real, save your money and get something that has proper padding.
customer_reviews.author: Gopal Metro

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love These Rockers!
customer_reviews.text: I sent these rockers to my grandsons (6,5 & 4 yrs.) FL. My daughter tells me that they love their rockers! Because they come in 3 different colors, I can buy a different color for each boy and they don't fight over them. Because they're vinyl, they can't stain them. I only sent them about a month ago, so I can't speak to their durability with children. But they're perfect for them to watch TV on. They each have their own special seat and can rock to sooth themselves. (Since they live in FL, they have tile floors which are hard and cold, so these are a comfy way to sit on the floor.)
customer_reviews.author: FLNewGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable chairs for my 4 and 7 year old boys. They watch tv and play games in them.
customer_reviews.author: LouLou1355

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart with one year
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much canvas over some sort of internal skeleton. After a while the left and right side started shifting around. I can tell whatever internal structure it had is collapsing. Not sure of the cause. They were not used hard, just boys sitting in them and rocking around playing games.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Really small
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in great condition just a little bit smaller than I expected it to be. It’s probably my fault for not reading into the dimensions I just thought all banana chairs were the same and this one is more for a small child to like preteen it’s to small for an adult unless there are really short and small. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: C Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the chair was great until the upper back started to fall apart. This chair is lightly used for about a month and the seems are coming apart. For the price I would go with a different company. I had one that I bought from target for 50 dollars that lasted me 5 years. What brought that ones demise was a 260 pound man falling on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my son and he absolutely loves it. The chair is well worth the price and it is made very well. I would recommend this chair for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Keri Horner

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Well I will start by saying it is very low quality, mine was already damaged upon arrival, maybe it was fed ex maybe it was wal mart either way neither one knew what to do so it ended with me stopping payment in order to not be ripped off.. Fed ex picked the item up to send it back and I never heard anything again.. Lol. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Won’t stay up. Kids won’t sit in them. Put them in storage pretty much immediately after buying them then sold them on OfferUp last week two for $20.0
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Ripped at seams at the seat portion.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to pretty cheaply put together with not much support or padding. No support in the seat, so when my child sat in it for less than a week, it ripped at the side seam and rip just keeps getting worse.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: The chair gives me back pain
customer_reviews.text: This chair seems great for kids but as a 5'11 20 year old i would not recommended it . The chair is built well but is honestly uncomfortable . When i lean back i feel a wooden bar in it slamming against my upper back which causes back pain after a while . The chair doesn't have much padding either . Honestly i would advise against buying this if you are an adult but maybe consider it if you have a kid .
customer_reviews.author: Ben lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an almost indestructible chair for my rough and tumble boys and this is holding up. I like it because it’s one piece and doesn’t fold.
customer_reviews.author: J. Herron

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted something for my kids to sit on when they're playing video games. The kids are constantly rocking back on these. Hopefully they don't ever hit their head as our floor is hardwood. Also if you have hardwood these might leave marks on the floor. PERMANENT marks in my beautiful hardwood floor. We have learned to place mats on the floor & then place the chairs on top of them to further prevent any more damage. So bottom line if you want something inexpensive and plan on placing them on carpeting or vinyl then this is a good buy but steer clear of hardwood floors!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Racy gaming chair looks cool and is comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks cool, very racy, love the bright green and black contrast. It's pretty low to the ground, but comfortable once you sit in it. Rocks nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Hudachko

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made But Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: It's only $30-40 but it didn't last a year. Completely flattened out and broken down after 11 months of use by a 12 year old. Probably to be expected, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: 50% of chairs purchased had tears in less than hour of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 for Christmas gifts for my 7 and 10 year old. They are comfortable and fit both kids well. One arrived with 2 small knicks to the vinyl at the bottom edge and within 30 min of use the knicks had turned into large tears. The 2nd chair arrived in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: The product was never used it was too small for my child. I was unable to return it ,with the return label that was sent ; due to the size of the box. I’m sure the seller was aware of that , prior to sending . So I purchased a regular sized chair, and this one is just sitting here. If you have a child over 4 feet, do not purchase this chair. It also doesn’t sit up on its own , and the fabric is very thin. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia byrd

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY not worth it
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY !!!!!!!!!!!Chair is not made well and will not last the fabric is ripped at the seem and not repairable IV contracted the seller band have not had a response
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this. It needs a wheely bar so I dont tip over lol. Comfortable and light weight! Super happy so far. I'm 190, 5'10"
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is a good chair. It is perfect for additional seating for watching tv/playing video games but not so much as your primary chair in my opinion due to a lack of padding for your rear. I am 6'2" 185lbs and i fit fine in the chair. Sitting up right, the back of the chair comes just over my shoulders, but no where near high enough to rest my head. The width of the seat is fine for someone my size too. Like I said earlier, great seat for additional tv viewers/gamers but I wouldn't recommend as your primary rec room chair.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price so cheap product.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a cheap chair. But a cheap price. It’s working for the kids. But already has split the seems in the seat just three months after purchase. Don’t expect much.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Christmas & my stepson absolutely loves it!! It's comfortable & he plays a lot of video games so this was perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha D

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: There is almost no padding. It's not comfortable to sit on. Also, if you're a little wide-reared, then it's even more uncomfortable because the frame will press into your side butt. I would not buy this again. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Little back support and not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair, wouldn't return it, but not very comfortable. I just throw a pillow behind me while gaming to make up for the lack of back support.
customer_reviews.author: C.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids room!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my sons room (toddlers)! My husband is 6’1 and when he sits on it ...he doesn’t feel supported. I feel comfortable on it but I think it’s more suited for children. I am happy with the purchase for my children!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids - not super comfy.
customer_reviews.text: Not super comfortable but worth the money for kids. Would recommend this for an adult, but great for a our 9 and 11 year olds to play they video games. For an adult these would be torture. Feels like hard cardboard to me
customer_reviews.author: NH Bella

customer_reviews.title: Good chairs for good price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about six years ago. They lasted about 4 years with 2 pre-teen boys sitting and playing video games in them almost every day, before they gave way to tears. That's pretty good!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: cute chair, but...
customer_reviews.text: The chair is good for gaming; however, be careful that the person in the chair does not lean too far back or he/she will go backwards onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Not as padded as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable and not balanced at all - I know it’s supposed to rock obviously- but other chairs like this I have owned had a balance to them.
customer_reviews.author: Pt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kids gaming chair
customer_reviews.text: We originally ordered a couple of these chairs from a different place and they came damaged and they did not have the ones we wanted so we ordered these ones. They fit our kids who are 7 & 10 perfectly and have held up to the abuse a typical kid puts them through.
customer_reviews.author: Cari J

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I got it has a birthday gift for my 5 years old with Autism. She uses it more then most of the other stuff I buy her. It's pretty sturdy she turned it over and used it has a slide for a couple of days. (Until I bought her a slide) & it never ripped the back or anything. I might have to by another for her father.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: Not big enough for an adult to be comfortable. Plus the staples ripped out before I could even get it out of the box. Immediate return.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Krebs

customer_reviews.title: Cheap chair.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who is a gamer. He has to add additional pillows to the chair to support his back and add cushion. Already broken as it was cheaply made. He went to get up and a board snapped on the side. He now just sits on his pillow made area. Chair is not worth much . He got the chair in March for a gift and did t nor last a year. Would not get again.
customer_reviews.author: daphanie caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Love these chairs I got 2 of them now I've got too order 2 more should have done that in the first place since I knew my girls would fight my boys for the chairs lol but my boys love them and use them daily
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Would work okay for children but is very uncomfortable and too cheaply made for an adult to use without risk of it breaking, we ordered 2 one of which broke within the first month.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: For the price its pretty worth it but if you a hardcore gamer i'd ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price its pretty worth it but if you a hardcore gamer i'd say spend the money for a better one. But if your in the market for a occasional game chair or even a wear chair to watch tv on its pretty worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable seat, needs padding on the base
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks good but, not comfortable for more than a few minutes. We had to add a cushion to the seat. The base of the chair is not padded and creates creases in the carpet/flooring. Had to put a pad under the chair to protect the flooring. One and done purchase
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my grandson for his 7th birthday. He uses it for gaming and watching TV and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Muccie

customer_reviews.title: No back support, but otherwise nice
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be of good construction, but I purchased it because I needed a chair with lower back support and this does not have it. It's too rounded at the lower back, so you'd need a pillow. Return shipping wouldn't be worth the refund so this was a wasted $22. But if you don't have back issues, it's probably a great chair. My five year old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Much Larger than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased, I had done a search for child size gaming chair. It serves its purpose, but it is big.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for young kids
customer_reviews.text: My 9 and 7-year-old boys needed something to sit on while watching movies or playing Wii in their play room. My boys aren't particularly destructive, but they're still boys and manage to wreck stuff, so I didn't want to spend a lot of money. These chairs seemed to fit the bill given their price and fair rating. As I think others noted, they aren't well padded, but they get the job done and my boys love them. We've had them for three months now, the boys use them everyday, and they're still intact. I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Spizzirri

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for an 8 year old. He loves it. It's study but definitely not for heavy use like jumping on.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Tess

customer_reviews.title: Decent I suppose, but don't pay more than $25 for this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Clunky, thin upholstery and not very comfortable. Doesn't sit up right, without anyone in the chair it will roll backwards. As usual on Amazon, not sure if all are like this as some of the pictures from other reviews look like completely different chairs. Either way, I'll never understand why you can't make a decent product and charge a bit more, this is just a waste of materials.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my baby boy.
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it. Posted in front of his tv right now lol. Im the cool mom now he says
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Low build quality
customer_reviews.text: What do you expect for $40? That's exactly what you're getting here. I am 5'7, 180 lbs. I used it sparingly for less than 2 weeks and the wood broke on the right side. The refunded so there was no problem there. It's just a garbage chair. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lowe

customer_reviews.title: as a full-size adult I fit fine but I find it to be really uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these (similar, anyway) a few years ago. I bought the budget model online. So, as a full-size adult I fit fine but I find it to be really uncomfortable. Basically there's not enough cushion for you to sit on, you feel the wood. My kids and even my cat are big fans, though.
customer_reviews.author: casa swow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My five year old loves it. Light weight and durable. Perfect for kids and adults alike.
customer_reviews.author: James Mason

customer_reviews.title: You can use it as ground rocking chair
customer_reviews.text: They are pieces of wood in back support if using the game chair they press constantly against your spine which is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D Jones

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is good for kids but I was hoping to make use of it as an adult too. I can fit in it ok, but it's not very comfortable and digs in after like an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Not very comfortable, you can feel the wood frame when sitting. Also it goes back easily has no support on the back. If you push your self a little you fall back easily. The padding is very light.
customer_reviews.author: JRod

product_meta.title: THE CREW FURNITURE Classic Video Rocker
feature_bullets: Perfect for floor activities, playing video games, watching TV, reading, relaxing, or just hanging out with your crew.
Modernistic, ergonomic style, built on a wood frame and padded with polyurethane foam.
Choose between attractive bold mesh racing stripes or solid color.
Faux leather vinyl wipes clean with a damp cloth.
Dimensions (W x D x H): 16 x 24 x 32 inches. Ages 3yrs & up. Fully assembled.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
